questions.question_text:
Fred created a parent/child relationship between the Employees and Departments.
//IMG//

Fred wants to hide the Departments region.
What should Fred do to achieve this?

choices.B: Set the Road Only condition to "Always"
choices.D: Set the Read Only condition to "Never"

discussion.content: Doesn't make sense to me, correct answer should be A.

questions.question_text:
Jim has developed a form page. When running the page, the data displayed is not what he expected. Therefore, he wants to review the information in session state while debugging the form.
How can Jim accomplish this?

choices.D: Click the View Debug button on the Developer toolbar.
choices.B: Click the Session button on the Developer toolbar.
choices.C: Add a debug flag to the URL and rerun the page.
choices.A: View page source information in the browser.
choices.E: Edit the page and update session state items to "Display Only".

questions.question_text: Which three sources can be used for a classic report? (Choose three.)

choices.F: PL/SQL stored procedure with the OUT parameter
choices.C: PL/SQL function returning a SQL query
choices.D: PL/SQL function returning a single value variable

discussion.content: No, D is the choice to make.

comments.content: Why do you say it's verified ? Where did you get this information from ? It doesn't make sense to set value, since the value is already set by clicking on the item itself.

discussion.content: B, Set Value Using SQL Statement Dynamic Action

questions.question_text:
Kyle is developing a page with an interactive report, called Employees, using this query:
SELECT EMPNO, ENAME, JOB, DEPTNO FROM EMP WHERE DEPTNO = nvl(:P3_DEPTNO, DEPTNO)
On the page, Kyle adds a select list, called P3_DEPTNO, using this query:
SELECT dname, deptno FROM dept;
He creates a dynamic action on change of P3_DEPTNO, with a true action of "Refresh" against the Employees region.
Kyle then runs the page and selects ACCOUNTING in the P3_DEPTNO item. However, the report still shows employees from all departments.
What must Kyle do to correctly display only employees from the department selected?

choices.D: Set "Page Items to Submit" to P3_DEPTNO in the report
choices.B: Add an additional true action of Set Value by using Static Assignment in Dynamic Action
choices.C: Set a column on the DEPTNO column
choices.A: Add a computation set to P3_DEPTNO

questions.question_text:
Robin develops many apps in his workspace that use various APEX plug-ins. Some apps use the same plug-in as other apps. When a newer version of a plug-in is available, Robin has to update the plug-in in multiple apps.
How can Robin upgrade a plug-in once and have all other apps that use the same plug-in get updated at the same time?

choices.D: Create a "Plug-ins Master" app where he stores all plug-ins and then subscribes the plug-ins in all of his other apps to the plug-ins in the "Plug-ins Master" app.
choices.C: Update one of the plug-ins, and then click Push Update to update the other apps.
choices.A: Run a SQL command to update the plug-in definition in each application.
choices.B: Write a PL/SQL package that he can reuse to update the plug-in definitions in each application.

discussion.content: D would be the optimal solution
